website_summaries.verdict: Turned off by the subscriptions and connectivity hurdles for other machines? Then consider the ScanNCut2 from Brother, which requires no subscriptions and even has computer-free options.
pros: Lets you turn scanned images into unique cut designs and patterns
Features 4.85-inch LCD touchscreen for easy operation
Standalone, PC, and wireless network connectivity options
Compatible with  Microsoft Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8 and Windows 8.1, Windows 10
No cartridges, dyes or monthly subscriptions
cons: Mat is sticky at first, and you can damage paper removing it

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you want to cut fabric!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Scan n Cut2 for ease of cutting fabric. Wow! The standard mat didn't hold, the purchase of Scan n Cut high tack sheets are a joke! Why should a customer need to purchase special sheets that are easily cut by Scan n Cut blade?! I starched and ironed fabric between sheets of purchased freezer paper, the fabric didn't cut in corners BUT the mat was cut through!!! I give up...not for cutting fabric!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Kuzmick

customer_reviews.title: Incredible machine for all stamping/scrapbooking/crafts
customer_reviews.text: Love that it worked right out of the box. Some of it was intuitive, the rest was learned on U Tube. still learning. So much fun. Love the ah ha moments.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy Bare

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, consider another brand
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Cuts right through basic images, squares and rectangles and circles.
customer_reviews.author: Renee C Cullar

customer_reviews.title: Didn't realize this was used!
customer_reviews.text: Returned. I didn't realize this was a used product. That could have been my fault but when I went back and looked at it, it said "like new" but it was missing pieces and the mat was completely cut through and not sticky at all so I don't consider that like new. I couldn't even use it without buying a mat first so I just returned it. It might be a good machine but I didn't get a chance to even try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Frisby

customer_reviews.title: Awsome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my wife and she absolutely loves it. She is a crafty person and this fits right into her craft room. Awsome buy.
customer_reviews.author: David Powell

customer_reviews.title: Brother ScanNCut a Great Journal Making Tool
customer_reviews.text: As a journal maker and crafter, I enjoy the ease of use and the many online videos available to help in utilizing ways to better enhance the ways that this fabulous machine can be used to cut out digital items to use in my decoration of my vintage journal pages. It saves me lots of time and makes my projects look professional.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I choose this over any other ones! It's a nice machine but I feel the pricing is a little high for what it is
customer_reviews.author: Drew neisinger

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Could never get this machine to work properly. I tried to contact support and got bounced around. I wish I could return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene J Mayhew

customer_reviews.title: Aweful precision
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting way more from this product the cutting precision is bad is not a great product I think for what it cost
customer_reviews.author: Taíno Flavor

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for an experienced crafter. It's very difficult to use. It's time consuming and $$$ the cricut does all the same things without the headache
customer_reviews.author: shauna

customer_reviews.title: Scanning feature is useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could cut my own designs. The scanning feature is pretty much useless. Even with a high contrast line drawing with complete outlines (as recommended by customer service), it doesn't recognize each section. And I have little use for the lame designs that come pre-installed.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Furtado

customer_reviews.title: Timesaver
customer_reviews.text: Use this to cut out embellishments for card making and scrapbooking. Working well for what it was purchased for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I would like a full refund because it didn't work properly and its defective.
customer_reviews.author: pedro villela

customer_reviews.title: Error message when open
customer_reviews.text: Error message, feeder release lever is realsaed, lock feeder release lever .. Looked up code, says to reset.. did so.. no luck.. stuck in this mode.. This is Disappoing....
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cutting tool
customer_reviews.text: I like the scan n cut. It always you to do so many different projects. I’m still learning.
customer_reviews.author: Smallchange

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like it
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like it because you only have to buy the original mat
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I hate this product. Wish I could return it!! Not happy with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rushing

customer_reviews.title: Watch the videos on cleaning the mats. I have used mine over and over by cleaning it correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to be able to download photos and put them on different items. It is not as easy as they make it sound, but I have made some leather jewelry and it cuts really nice. It is fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine! Takes a bit to get it figured out but it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I tried wasn’t scanning my images. Had to spend more money and upgraded. Hopefully this one works.
customer_reviews.author: Malay

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Still trying to figure it out but I love this machine I don't have to guess what thickness to cut it does it for me.
customer_reviews.author: ClaraMae

customer_reviews.title: Love my machine!
customer_reviews.text: I love to make cards and decorate t-shirts for my grand daughter. This machine is perfect for that!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Whitney

customer_reviews.title: More affordable and Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this ScanNCut. It has a scanner. U can scan images in (not camera photos) and have it cut them out! U can also use it for appliqué. Watched a lot of YouTube videos on it b4 I bought it then found this newest model that was more affordable than some of the other models! Yea!
customer_reviews.author: kjtup

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Could use better software the complete work on the computer stand alone is great but the computer side
customer_reviews.author: MJS_11:11

customer_reviews.title: purchased as new received it used
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as new, but I received it used. Cutting mat was used and un-usable.. I ordered it in an amazon package. and it was not in the amazon box.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy-Jean Hegwine

customer_reviews.title: more instructions  on using the machine
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the machine will cut my fabrics. I use it for quilting
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be patient
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok to use not easy takes a little time
customer_reviews.author: elijah

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, Not For Me - Sorry - Maybe You Will Find It Good - Too Much For Me
customer_reviews.text: Brother makes a number of great printer options. Unfortunately, the CM350E ScanNCut2 with Online Activation Card was nothing but trouble for me. I could not get it to activate. I'm sure someone that is familiar might be able to get it going, but this was my first time trying. I failed, or the instructions and online service did. Whichever, I finally gave up. For this reason, I didn't want to totally trash this item. It seems well built, but the instructions are confusing. I felt I could only give it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like am inkjet printer, but for making stencils.
customer_reviews.text: When you first unpack this Brother Cutting Machine, you'll think it a familiar experience akin to unpacking that inkjet printer including all the tape you need to remove, etc. But from there, the experiences will diverge. This is a more complicated machine than one that lays down ink on paper. I am still getting the hang of it, but the gist of the matter is that it takes some practice and adjustments to get the best results. Nothing wrong with that as long as you don't expect printer-level plug and play. I am making stencils for roller ink application, but this will also be perfect for cutting out shapes for your scrapbook as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wildness

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner, and I found it easy to get started. Still learning the ropes, but overall I'm satisfied. I wish I could expand, but I'm still learning!
customer_reviews.author: HEYOOO

customer_reviews.title: What to use to make shirts logo
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I can use this to print on shirt or if this is the right Circuit
customer_reviews.author: Victoria villa

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite model to use in cardmaking. I use it all the time. This is my second one...just in case something happens to first one which is 3 years old now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cutter w/limitation
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great cutter - it's complicated so take your time getting to know it and give yourself a couple projects to figure it out. In short, it's frustrating but definitely learnable if you're patient. I had some great results after some practice! Another reviewer mentioned this and I wanted to confirm: Downloading designs to cut was less precise. Sizes didn't match up properly. Overall, it's a steep learning curve, but do-able!
customer_reviews.author: CCE

customer_reviews.title: Genius
customer_reviews.text: I watched several YouTube videos to make sure I really understood how to use this. There’s plenty out there to watch. This was too easy so I wanted to make sure I was doing it right. It’s quick and easy to set up. I love that I can just scan what I want for my projects.
customer_reviews.author: 🌟 FilipinaBarbie 🌟

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING machine but takes a minute to get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Brother ScanNCut2 for a few months now and I still am working my way to its highest potential but have had a lot of fun learning along the way. It was easy to set up but took some time to get used to the different formats and cutting styles. I am looking forward to making lots of unique gifts for myself and friends!
customer_reviews.author: NaughtiLiterati

product_meta.title: Brother CM350E ScanNCut 2 Cutting Machine with Scanner, Make DIY Vinyl Wall Décor, Custom Stickers and Stencil Sheets with 631 Included Patterns, ScanNCut Online Activation Card
product_meta.description: Style Name:New Model: CM350EBrother ScanNCut2 is an incredible innovation in electronic cutting machines. The ScanNCut2 is a standalone machine with a built-in scanner which gives artists the freedom to make truly unique, one- of-a-kind creations with the push of a button. It provides users with the flexibility of connecting wirelessly or directly to a PC and scanning images directly to the system, and it features a large cutting area to cut and draw a variety of shapes and designs with precision. Additionally it does not require cartridges, dyes, or monthly subscriptions and includes multiple built-in features that simplify the process. This 23.25x11x11 inch package contains one machine, one standard but blade holder, one standard cut blade, one spatula, one 12x12 inch mat, two color pen set (black and red), one pen holder, one touch pen and one ScanNCut online activation card. Imported.
feature_bullets: Create right out of the box: The CM350E electronic cutting machine gives you the option to work directly on your machine with the 631 Built-in designs and easy-to-use editing tools on the 4.85" touchscreen LCD display. No PC or mobile device required

Scan drawings: The 300dpi built in scanner allows you to scan your drawing to convert it to a one-of-a-kind cut file, directly cut printed stickers, and precisely place designs without counting blocks. File Formats Supported: FCM, SVG

Stunning DIY projects: Craft with 631 built-in designs, including 100 quilt designs and 7 lettering fonts. Add your own SVG design files and additional free patterns via a free Canvas Workspace account using the USB port and wireless capability
Cuts up to 2 mm thickness: The Brother Home Electronic Cutting Machine effortlessly cuts materials up to 2mm thick such as paper, vinyl, fabric and foam

Included in the box: The CM350E comes with a 12" x 12" standard tack mat, standard blade and holder, black and red pens and holder, touch pen, spatula, accessory pouch, pattern collection with 76 additional patterns, and Scan N Cut online activation card

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars671 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
